definition:
&%CommunicationOrganization is
the subclass of &%Organizations that manage &%Communications over physical
infrastructure owned or leased by the organization.  Such organizations
may also produce and disseminate information, entertainment, or other
content.  Also see &%MediaOrganization.
opposite_reasoning: This provides the strongest semantic opposition while maintaining ontological consistency (both are Organization types). For Fisher-LDA, having μ+ be organizations that manage communication infrastructure and μ- be organizations that explicitly do not manage such infrastructure creates a meaningful axis. This is more useful for AI safety monitoring than cross-category opposites (entity vs. state) because it helps distinguish organizational purposes and functions. The concept should be added to layers as a complementary organizational type - defining what organizations ARE by contrasting with what they ARE NOT is valuable for ontological completeness.
